channel.title: Reliable cron job service - FastCron
channel.description: You can create and manage cronjobs for multiple websites, with your team. Know when your cron jobs are executed, get failure notifications via email, Slack, and webhooks.

item.title: Scheduled maintenance
item.description: To pause cronjobs during a planned outage, you can schedule a maintenance. Your cronjobs won't run during a scheduled maintenance period.

item.title: Notify when cronjob output contains a word
item.description: You can receive email, Slack, Discord notifications when your cronjob output does/doesn't contain a word

item.title: Priority level: a better way to categorize items
item.description: You can now set priority (Normal, High, Higher) for cronjobs, groups, variables, notification channels, and team members.

item.title: WordPress plugin to run wp-cron.php for free
item.description: Simple, fast, and free. Just install and activate our WP plugin and it's done. No registration required.

item.title: The better way to run one-time cronjobs
item.description: Previously, you needed to create several cronjobs that run once. Now you just need to create one cronjob, then schedule it to run along with a payload.

item.title: List of free cronjob services in 2024
item.description: Need an alternative to your hosting provider cronjobs? Try one of these free online cronjob services!

item.title: Repeat cronjob execution
item.description: Rerun cronjob when/until its output matches a word.

item.title: Notify when cronjob succeeds after failed
item.description: Send email/Slack notifications when your cronjob succeeds after it failed before.

item.title: Max instances / overlapping executions
item.description: You can prevent overlapping or allow up to 5 overlapping executions by adjusting the Max instances.

item.title: Account settings
item.description: I've added a new tab to change the default cronjob settings.

item.title: One-time cronjob time settings
item.description: If you're setting cronjobs to run once at a specific time, please ensure that it's at least 15 seconds into the future.

item.title: Time filter
item.description: Filter scheduled executions to match both the day of the week and the day of the month

item.title: Cron notifications to owner AND member
item.description: FastCron can now send cron notifications to both the account owner and other team members.

item.title: How to run cron job every 10 seconds
item.description: You can run cronjobs every 10 seconds using Unix crontab or FastCron service.

item.title: How to run cron job every 20 seconds
item.description: You can run cronjobs every 20 seconds using Unix crontab or FastCron service.

item.title: Viewer / Read-only team member
item.description: You can now invite/add a team member with a Viewer role.

item.title: Run another cronjob after execution
item.description: You can now run another cronjob after a cronjob successful execution.

item.title: SetCronJob is now FastCron
item.description: New name, new logo, same old reliable cronjob service!

item.title: How to run cron job every 30 seconds
item.description: You can run cronjobs every 30 seconds using Unix crontab or FastCron service.

item.title: Hello world!
item.description: This is the beginning of the most reliable cronjob service
